dialogues.text: Flipping through a stack of postcards he has just purchas Wills waits for Charlotte to come out of the ladies room. He idly glances up as a STREAM OF TOURISTS moves past. He about to look away when his eye catches someone. It is Lisa, the young woman who spoke to Charlotte at the benefit. Around her neck she wears a chain bearing a Met  employee photograph I.D. She carries a take-out coffee. Wills FOLLOWS HER, agitated and curious. He sees her pass through a set of glass doors into the Wa Research Library. He hurries over to the doors just in time to see her disa behind a bank of card catalogues. Wills notices a sign at the door that forbids entry to th public. He hesitates, then enters. He speaks to the first person he sees -- a ROTUND FEMALE  LIBRARIAN IN HER 60'S. He stops and asks a question about Lisa. She nods. Wills is shaken by the answer. He stares into the middle  distance, wondering what to do, his mind racing. The librarian, a little nervous now, reminds him that he not allowed in the library. He snaps to, thanks her, and  moves away. But then he stops, takes out a BUSINESS CARD, and returns the librarian. He is about to hand it to her, but then he thinks better of it. Flustered, he thanks her again and exits. The librarian l after him, confused and a little apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sees Charlotte at the end of the hall looking aroun for him. When she spots him, her face brightens. She call out facetiously as she walks to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to wait right  there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you didn't talk to  anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Charlotte stand, disrobing in the near-total  darkness. They converse in whispers, between kisses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what would scare me right  now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte moves slowly through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks a cord by the window. The BLIND OPENS and the r is flooded with MOONLIGHT. The room is still dark, but sh is far more clearly visible. Her dress is unbuttoned down the front. She walks back to him and stops about five feet away. She releases the last buttons on her dress, then slides i off her shoulders to the floor. She wears only her underw She crosses her arms over her breasts, and smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I told you my latest motto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's scary, do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I like that motto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes, takes a deep breath, then slips off underwear. She drops her arms to her side. She stands before him entirely naked. Her self-consciousness is excruciating but she is determi to endure it. Finally, she opens her eyes and smiles with hint of pride. Wills' eyes widen as he takes her in. He crosses to her a lays his hands on her hips. He kisses her neck. As their breathing quickens, she begins to unbutton his s and pull it free of his pants. He takes hold of her hands, stopping her, and starts to e her toward the bed. She resists. Wills falters and she  realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scared, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his expression, she knows she is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time since we've met him, Wills is utterly a loss. But he sees that Charlotte has no intention of ba down. He begins to undress. His hands are uncertain as he untuc his shirt and unbuckles his belt. When he is finished  undressing, he turns to face her, his arms at his side. Although we cannot see him in the moonlight and shadows,  Charlotte can. She looks down at his naked body and studi it. He stares back with shy wariness. Then she breaks into a crooked grin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, old man? Can't  afford a gym?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing, he grabs her wrists and throws her on the bed. dissolves into paroxysms of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Charlotte make love. As their passion builds,  Charlotte is suddenly stabbed with a pain in her chest. She grabs his back, her face twists. She holds her breath not wanting to reveal the incident to Wills. She closes h eyes and exhales as the pain subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Charlotte lie in bed with the blinds open and t city glimmering in the distance. Charlotte's head rests on his chest. Eyes closed, he brus his hand along her face as though he were a blind man  committing every detail to memory. Charlotte's voice, almost inaudible, drifts up through th dark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Counting the beats,  Counting the slow heart beats,  The bleeding to death of time  In slow heart beats,  Wakeful they lie."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills, half-asleep, murmurs deeply --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many words in that wonderful head  of yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could give you anything in the  whole world, that's what it would  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk falls on the park. Charlotte, red-cheeked and happy, carrying shopping bags, walks into a brisk autumn breeze. She smiles at a BUNCH OF SCHOOL KIDS, dressed in HALLOWEE COSTUMES, being led on their trick or treating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits at a desk, reading the newspaper. John, inspec a KING HENRY VIII COSTUME on a hanger, shouts into the  telephone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, your boy made it! At ten  minutes before close! All night I  got a card announcing a halibut  special, only I got no halibut! Now  it's Sunday and I got three dozen  cats lickin' their chops in the alley!  Tony, I don't wanna hear it! I don't  wanna hear it! I don't wanna -- MAN,  GO TO HELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams down the phone. His face is beet red. Wills look up calmly from his paper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with the phrase,  "You can catch more flies with honey  than with vinegar?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with the phrase,  "Mind your own god damn business?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, it's from Poor Richard's  Almanac. But the last time I checked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, your business is to smile, make  friends, and get rich! My business  is the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads out, then stops abruptly and looks back. His t is suddenly calm and curious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' here, anyway? You  got a girl. Go home. Carve a pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't spend every waking moment  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks at him strangely, with a hint of suspicion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? (pause) No, seriously. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills has no answer. John moves closer when Celia, his ne assistant, enters cheerily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special delivery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses him a paper bag; he catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills removes a PAIR OF RED PLASTIC HORNS. John shakes hi head with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every year. You got no imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a classic. A little spirit gum  and voila!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the horns up to his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- young women are rendered helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. I see a guy with horns  growing out of his head and my knees  go weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- it's biological.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh. A flirtatious charge passes between t She blushes slightly and exits. John looks suspiciously a Wills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills smiles at him as though he were insane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Honestly. We're having a  lot of fun. We're very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the next scene, we hear Charlotte laughing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come in! Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire burns in the fireplace. Still wearing his coat, wi stands by the mantel, sorting through a stack of mail --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even tempted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from another room) I'll be right out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia enters with a steamy mug --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like hot cider?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carefully takes his coat off him as he sips the cider

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte made it. I just poured it  in the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits. As Wills sips the drink, he sits on the leathe sofa and continues to glance through his mail. Suddenly, shocked, he stops on a letter. He sets his mug  down. He hears Charlotte making noise in the next room. H opens the letter and begins to read. His eyes dart down the page, but he quickly sees that the letter is not friendly. His face shows disappointment. He hears footsteps in the hall. He folds the letter up, s it back into its envelope, and jams it in his back pocket Charlotte enters and throws her hands out to her side --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta-da!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands before him, dressed in a WHITE SPINSTERLY VICT OUTFIT with braids coiled at her ears. Wills smiles with  appreciation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I look just like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hope is the thing with feathers  that perches in the soul."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the hint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dummy! Emily Dickinson! Only the  greatest American female poet ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs and kisses him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncultured swine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is out. I've lost you  forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays her head on his chest, smiling contentedly. A su shadow of apprehension passes over Wills' features. Eyes  closed, she asks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I get to see your costume?

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A cardboard ghost hangs on the door. A Jack-o'-lantern gr in the window. A HALLOWEEN PARTY is in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's wife, Sarah, dressed as QUEEN ELIZABETH, walks thr the crowd, picking up empty glasses and bottles. As she moves among COSTUMED GUESTS and their CHILDREN, we notice a few of Elysium's customers and staff, including  Celia, dressed as GLINDA, talking to the maitre d', Jesus dressed as a COWBOY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think we make a great couple.  A good witch and a bad hombre. That  could make for some very interesting  sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celia laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stands off to the side, wearing his devil's horns,  sipping a drink, watching an EIGHT-YEAR-OLD BOY bob for  apples, while other BOYS and GIRLS cheer him on. John, wearing his king costume, supervises, as the boy, w sputtering, struggles to bite into a renegade Granny Smit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O, Ricky, chill out! You're gonna  get snot in the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy laughs even harder. John facetiously grabs his co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it -- outta the pool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy, choking with laughter, plunges his face into the water again. Sarah enters and calls out over the din --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're the girls? I thought you  were tucking them in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a volunteer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, smiling curiously, heads to the back stairwell. She sees Wills standing there. Watching the kids, his eye are filled with the same sort of wistful yearning that sh noticed at the toy store -- She gives him an affectionate poke in the stomach as she  passes by and disappears upstairs. Finally, the boy grabs the apple in his teeth and lifts h soaked head to the cheers of his friends. Then he grabs it out of his mouth and begins taking big b out of it until he uncovers a SILVER DOLLAR. Wills laughs at the kids' excitement. A moment later a WO GLOVED HANDS cover his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills feels her LONG GLOVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder Woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batgirl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a hint. You dumped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Princess Di?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and playfully strangles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and sees that it's the woman from the film's ope dressed as HOLLY GOLIGHTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, I'd know that throttle anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stops silently at an AJAR DOOR and looks inside.  Charlotte sits on a bed between the twin girls who are ne up against her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, but this is the last last  one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clears her throat and settles herself. The twins list with rapt attention as she recites from memory, slowly as though it were a suspenseful bedtime story --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Because I could not stop for Death,  He kindly stopped for me;  The carriage held but just ourselves  And Immortality.  We slowly drove, he knew no haste,  And I had put away  My labor, and my leisure too,  For his civility."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks up and sees Sarah, who face is beaming wi affection. They share a smile and Charlotte keeps recitin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We passed the school where children  played  At wrestling in a ring;  We passed the fields of grazing grain,  We passed the setting sun."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah eases the door shut and steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA makes a CIRCUIT of the THINNING CROWD. Sarah b out candles, dumps ash trays, and collects empties. Charlotte, rubbing a knuckle into her sleepy eye, descend the stairs. She sees Celia talking to Jesus, and walks ov to them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea I was so tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from across the room) They're down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And out. (looking around) Where's Lucifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Last time I saw him, he was in the  kitchen going pretty heavily with  Holly Golightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no gossip! Holly's a valued  customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte pretends to be fighting mad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme at 'er!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell hath no fury like a recluse  scorned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs and heads to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John wipes down the table which is littered with bits of  apple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, shouldn't one of your minions  be doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, in my day, you bobbed for  the apple, and, sure, maybe there  was a nickel inside it and that was  sweet -- but you ate the god damn  apple! These little animals grab the  coin and they're out the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- off to buy crack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly my point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen Beelzebub around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince of Darkness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he went upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks down the hall, opening doors and glancing inside. She opens a bathroom and THREE CATS dash out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets to the end of the hall and is about to give up.  When she hears FOOTSTEPS. She walks around the corner and sees a NARROW STAIRCASE  leading to the third floor. At the dark at the top of the stairs Wills and Wendy appe Charlotte smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost your horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were checking out the roof. John's  got quite a set-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, this is Charlotte Fielding.  Charlotte -- my friend Wendy Lister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile and shake hands. Charlotte looks at them both  carefully for any sign of uneasiness. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I saw you at that memorial  service in Connecticut. Your eulogy  was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her outfit) Betsy Ross, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guessed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills smiles and rubs his hands together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the party over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOWN CAR speeds toward Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Charlotte stare straight ahead, each lost in  thought. The lights of the city illuminate their faces in eerie flashes. Finally, Wills glances over and smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a strange feeling that you're  upset with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was just wondering if you had  sex with that woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the answer to that's pretty  obvious. I meant tonight. On the  roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills breaks into a grin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills laughs to himself, then glances up and sees the  reflection of the driver's amused eyes in the rearview mi Wills smiles back at Charlotte --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. Why would I want to  do something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was wondering. I  thought, "We're so happy he'd have  no reason to do it. And if he did do  it, he'd at least look guilty,  wouldn't he? But he doesn't. He looks  more relaxed than before the party  started."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there you have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then I thought, "He's a womanizer --  that's what they say." Funny word,  huh? Sounds like some sorta machine.  "And how do you get to be a womanizer?  Obviously by sleeping with lots of  different women for no good reason  and being really good at lying about  it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, except that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Wills looks up at the driver's eyes in the mirror. They seem more serious now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, there's something about being  sick right here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches her own chest. Her voice trembles slightly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- that has made me acutely aware of  my heart. Nothing corny -- I mean,  literally... I feel every beat. I  know how sensitive it is. It reacts  to everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns in her seat and lifts an OPEN PALM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lying to me, I'll know it. (beat) Did you have sex with Wendy on the  roof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her as though he were indulging a child. She looks him deeply in the eye and opens a button of his shi She slips her palm inside, over his heart. Still smiling, he doesn't move a muscle. Their eyes are locked. Ever so slowly, her face crumples and tears appear in her eyes. She shakes her head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides away from him, drops her face into her hands, begins to cry. Wills looks down, then glances up at the  rearview mirror. Illuminated in flashes, the driver's eyes have taken on a ominous, unblinking quality as though they were the outwa embodiment of his own conscience. Wills looks out the window. When he finally speaks, his v is calm and a little cold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I never pretended to be anything  other than --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a piteous cry) You hate yourself so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills is stunned. He looks out the window, speechless, hi eyes small and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town car is stopped at the curb, motor running, light on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte and Wills sit in silence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was all a mistake. Right from  the start. All of it. I'm a grown  man and you're a child. (beat) Anyway, you have better things to do  with your last -- With your time  than spend it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distantly) What about you? Do you have anything  better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills has no answer. Charlotte slowly gets out of the car She leans back in, her eyes narrow with disdain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, maybe you're right. Maybe  this is the best time to end it.  Because I was actually starting to  love you, Wills, and that's the last  thing I ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charlotte enters, we hear Wills' cab pull away. She mo to the stairs and sees a LIGHT shining beneath the living room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores sits watching an old movie, her eyes dulled by a  cataract of boozy fatigue. The door opens. She looks up a sees Charlotte in costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it ain't the Belle of  Amherst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte smiles feebly and plops down on the cracked lea ottoman. She looks blankly at the TV. She sniffles and wi a hand across her nose. Dolores glances over, then back a the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen that face before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for the same god damn reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is confused, but then puts it together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said Wills and my Mom were  just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but she was nuts about him.  The only reason she didn't sleep  with him is 'cause she was  sentimental. And smart. She wanted a  ring first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't he give her one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause he knocked up little Millie  Tyler instead. In Newport. At Bailey's  Beach. During the Labor Day clam  bake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She chuckles grimly, coughs, and sips her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie was your mom's best friend  from Nightingale. You had to hand it  to him. He sure knew how to make a  point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She coughs again. Charlotte struggles to make sense of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, who the hell knows? 'Cause the  moon was full. 'Cause life's short.  'Cause he's Wills Keane. I'll tell  you a little secret -- after that,  your Mom hated his guts, but your  dad never made her smile like he  did. (pause) 'Course your dad never made her cry  like that either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Why didn't you tell me any of this  before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I dunno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never talk to me! You never try  to help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores' eyes grow nervous. She swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, look at me. I'm gonna tell  you what to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! You're my family. You're supposed  to take care of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you wouldn't listen. That's the  thing about people -- they just do  what they want from the day they're  born till the day they die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She realizes her poor choice of words. She looks over and their eyes collide. Charlotte begins to cry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's you, Dolly! People who  have given up don't listen to other  people! People who want to die close  off! That's not me! I wanted your  help! I wanted to learn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte drops her head dejectedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything... anything you would ever  have told me, I would have listened  to! I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting tears) Aw, come on, honey. I can throw a  party and I can mix a gimlet. After  that, what the fuck do I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises, gives Charlotte a nervous, awkward pat on the  shoulder, then crosses over to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stands in the center of the room, looking around  blankly. He disappears into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills enters and sees some of Charlotte's clothes folded  neatly on the bed. A LITERARY ANTHOLOGY lies open, showin DRAWING OF EMILY DICKINSON. He grabs the clothes and the book and puts them in a SHOP BAG that she has left on the floor. Then he walks into the bathroom. We see him gathering BEA PRODUCTS off the sink. He walks back in and sets them int the shopping bag. He looks around and spots a nearly completed crossword pu sitting folded on the dresser. He drops that in the shopp bag, too, then sets it by the door. He feels a draft and spots an OPEN WINDOW. As he crosses it, he notices something on his pillow. A blank ENVELOPE. picks it up and rips it open. It's a HALLOWEEN CARD of a grinning JACK-O-LANTERN. He op it and inside is handwritten: The scariest night of the year and only one thing haunts that we might never have met. All my love,  XXX Charlotte. Wills lowers the card and heaves a deep breath. His jaw t he walks over and drops the card into the shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte emerges from the living room and shuts the door behind her. She climbs the stairs to her solitary bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From amid the RUSH OF TRAFFIC, a TAXI CAB breaks free and glides to the curb in front of Elysium. Wills emerges with PATTY, 35, bosomy, bright-eyed, pitche little too loudly. Wills seems stiff and tentative, a sha of his former self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ELDERLY COUPLE passes them as they enter. Wills stops the coat check and helps Patty with her coat. She admires the decor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Wills, it's beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although his spirits are low, he is effortlessly cordial

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It was designed by a team  from --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So functional! Is that stainless  steel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, no, it's velvet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She furrows her brow, squints, then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills hands Patty's coat to Melissa, the hat check girl, asks under his breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at Patty, Melissa asks with deep sympathy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Wills can respond, Patty takes his arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if the food's even half as  good as the moldings I'm in for a  very special treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus is surprised to see that Wills is not with Charlott

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh, good evening, Mr. Keane. Will  you be dining with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Jesus. Table seven, if it's  available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celia approaches, equally surprised not to see Charlotte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Celia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely) How are you this evening, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEW HOSTESS, Celia's replacement, arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Table Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patty) Order a drink. I'll be right with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty follows Celia. Wills moves to the reservation stand where John stands, stone-faced, flipping through the  reservation book --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Charlotte?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deliveries on time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the broad? She looks like a  Holiday-Inn hooker from Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep up the good work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, smoky, and boisterous. FIND CHARLOTTE, standing wit Simon. She looks around disgustedly and shouts above the  roar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm chugging Scotch, gagging  on smoke, and losing my hearing! Now  why is this so good for me again?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just it! The great spiritual  benefit in leaving one's room is  that it reminds one of how odious it  is to leave one's room!

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: FOLLOW SHANNON, coming out of the ladies' room. She makes her way through the crowd--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Excuse me! Sorry! Excuse  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up and can't believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO CHARLOTTE AND SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon, shouting above the music, speaks with difficulty -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one thing you don't know  about Mr. Keane and his adultery and  as painful as it is I feel that I  should tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What? What is it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman on the roof? That was no  ex-girlfriend! In fact, no woman at  all. It was I, Simon Loring, master  of disguise! Willsy and I have moved  in together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs and slaps him. Shannon approaches haulin by the hand ERIC BALES, 24, small, beautiful, long-haired glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte can't believe it either --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric! Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Char!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug and kiss with some slight awkwardness, then shou above the music --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, long time no see! One night we  show up to rent Eraserhead and you're  just gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was such a drag! You know, having  to actually start paying to rent  movies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? Ralph said you moved to  Rockland County!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got a job working for my  mom's new boyfriend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sells pot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I was a driver! I got  laid off when he got busted. He's  awaiting trial!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing pretty much. Only for  Domino's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, I don't believe it! (to Eric) She hasn't laughed in like a week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric smiles quizzically at Charlotte, wondering why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits listening to Patty talk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so everybody on the conference  call starts introducing themselves.  Ned Lewey, Paris Office. Takashi  Matsuo, Tokyo Office. Whoever, the  London Office. And then someone says,  "Will the architect from the New  York office please identify himself."  And I pipe up and say, "Well, guys,  I'm not a him or an architect. I'm  Patty Strauss and I'm head of East  Coast marketing." And there's like  total silence. It was hysterical!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills smiles feebly. He looks away and sees John holding TELEPHONE, urgently signaling to him. Alarmed, Wills jump up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, would you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RESERVATION STAND
dialogues.text: Wills, fearing the worst, hurries to John --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slams down the phone, grabs him by the arm, hauls hi through the reception area and out the door. Patty watche confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks quickly down the block, still hauling Wills --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I checked I was your best  friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So after the party, no thank you! I  call you three times -- no call back!  And for six days you don't even eat  at your own god damn restaurant!  What am I supposed to think? Huh?! I  was ready to call the morgue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, I'm alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you sure don't look it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks as quickly as he can with Wills struggling to  keep up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you why it's my concern!  Because I had a god damn swimming  pool! An ocean view! A fabulous lemon  tree hangin' right over my Jacuzzi!  And I gave it up for you, brother!  Back to a life of concrete and dirt  and sirens just so you could get  your shit together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, walking a little more slowly now, cannot believe hi ears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my roof? You gotta be kiddin'!  Not on my green chair! Tell me it  wasn't on the green chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great. Now how am I gonna clean  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks slowly now, backward, listening to an anxious  Wills --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it doesn't matter that she's  sick -- she's still a kid and there's  no way we should be together. It's  unhealthy... it's... it's  inappropriate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with disgust) What the hell is that? Some sorta  shrink talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if she were just fun... just  some sort of diversion... maybe I  could justify it. But the worst part  is that it's becoming more. Much  more. It's embarrassing how much I  like her. She gets to me. She affects  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and leans back against a building. He looks arou avoiding eye contact with John, as tears rise into his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gonna be gone and... I'm  not sure I can... I mean... I already  think about her all the time... (fighting tears) Her smile kills me... and the  thought... that it'll be gone...  forever... that I'll never see her  again... I don't know... I can't --  I don't think I'm that strong, Johnny.  It's too much. I'd rather have it be  over... over now. I'll start missing  her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills is still unable to look at him. John speaks softly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, I hate to break it to you,  but in the real world... where I  live... there're only two kindsa  love stories. Boy loses girl and  girl loses boy. That's all there is.  Somebody always gets left behind.  You try to avoid that, you'll end up  an old man toastin' yourself with  egg nog in the mirror on Christmas  Eve. You'll end up dying in your own  arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills lifts his frightened eyes. John pats him on the che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stands with Patty in the driveway in front of the g lobby. He is distracted and terribly anxious. She looks a though she expects, at the very least, a kiss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. I had such a great  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm... I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty, I... I want to be honest with  you... right now, from the start...  so there's no room for  misunderstanding. I didn't have a  good time, but it's nothing personal.  I just split up with someone and  rather than admit to myself how much  I miss her, I asked you out instead.  And it's unfair. If I feel sad I  should just feel sad and not try to  use you... and your body... as some  sort of painkiller, right? (beat) Anyway, I think you're a warm and  engaging woman and I wish you all  the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved to have unburdened himself of the truth, he shak her hand. Patty, utterly baffled, doesn't know what hit h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorman Michael, smoking a cigarette, sees Wills walk up, his expression pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Keane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stops and turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been waitin' almost an hour.  In the lobby. (off Wills' look) A little surprise for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks. Wills realizes that it's Charlotte. It must be. smiles and hurries inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills bursts in and freezes. A WOMAN stands across the wa studying an oil painting. She turns quickly. It's LISA. S sees his excited expression fall. Beneath her rather comp facade, Lisa is a chaos of conflicting emotions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Not at all. You surprised  me, that's all. I didn't expect to  see you... not here... not after  your letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't expect you to show up  at my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed you in. I wasn't even  sure it was you. All I have is an  old snapshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boss thought you were a stalker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to run off like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got my letter. What'd you do?  Freak out? Burn it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just blowing off some steam,  okay? I think I have the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. Look, why don't we go  upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasily) No. I didn't plan to come. Peter...  my husband... he agrees. He thinks  it's a futile exercise. But it turns  out I'm pregnant. Just a few months,  but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa -- Congratulations. That's  wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His sincerity stops her. She softens slightly, mustering tiny smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Anyway, I guess it made me  want to meet you. I've been a little  sentimental about parent-hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you consider me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a lousy absentee sorta way, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Nuts. She moved to Costa Rica  last summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy, what else? He owns a charter  airline and wears sunglasses indoors.  I think he might be a gunrunner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills chuckles. For the first time, Lisa relaxes enough t take him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're much better looking  in person than in photographs. I  always assumed Mom was exaggerating,  but she wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. You're not bad looking  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa smiles, and, much to her embarrassment, tears come t her eyes. She shakes her head at how absurd she is, treas kind words from a father she doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway... I should go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really just wanted to meet you  and... maybe... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) What is it? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sniffles and looks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing earth-shattering. Maybe just  to hear you say you were sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him long and hard, waiting for some more  palpable sign of remorse. It isn't forthcoming. Finally, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks away. His voice stops her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, hesitates for a moment, then nods. She  continues to the door. But then she stops and turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before... when you came in... who  did you think I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must like her an awful lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles simply and heads for the door. When she is gon Wells slowly walks back toward the elevators, but then  abruptly stops in his tracks, deliberating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA CRANES DOWN SLOWLY from a view of the sun risi in the EASTERN SKY to a TAXI gliding over to the curb in  front of...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE'S BROWNSTONE
dialogues.text: Charlotte, looking tired and a little pale, pays the driv and emerges from the taxi. She makes her way up the steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down from the second-floor landing, we see Charlo enter and walk up the stairs toward us. As she reaches the landing, she feels a STABBING PAIN IN CHEST and stops walking. Wincing, she waits for the pain subside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte enters wearily, drops her purse on the floor, t turns and GASPS. Wills lies sprawled in an armchair fully dressed, sound  asleep. Charlotte is offended by the intrusion. She hurries over awaken him. But then she stops. Her face softens slightly She studies his face... touches his cheek with the back o her hand... traces the lines at his eyes with a fingertip smooths back a wisp of hair. Finally, snapping to, steeling herself, she jostles him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills wakes with a violent start. When he sees her, he dr his head back. He closes his eyes again and murmurs sleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you? I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So worried you fell asleep. What're  you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you. You have no idea  how much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses coldly to her closet and, half-shutting the d blocking his view, starts to undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up, rubbing his eyes in the morning light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly. We watched TV. She fell asleep.  What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know I had a curfew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business. So what is  it? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits forward, more alert now. He exhales heavily an begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell you that you were right. I  do hate myself. But not so much that  I can't see how stupid and despicable  and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And cowardly what I did was. And  even though there's no excuse for  it, I want you to forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at him. She feels herself relenting. turns away and continues undressing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, for better or worse, I'm  falling in love with you, and the  thought of our not being together is  unbearable to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, then glances at him with a flash of pain and  longing. Determined not to surrender to her feelings, she crosses to the bed and throws open the covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the morning, we'll talk about  what a gigantic asshole you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills, relieved, crosses to the bed and begins to undress He asks casually --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Shannon and Simon and Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old friend who used to work at  Blockbuster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you guys do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talked and drank. Simon and Shannon  finally went home. Eric and I hung  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking nothing of it, Wills nods. He slips into bed. He back is to him. He drapes an arm around her and pulls her little closer. He smiles contentedly and closes his eyes. But then somet occurs to him. He opens his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hung out where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. We'll talk about it tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes again. A few beats later, they open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about what? Is there something  to talk about? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, eyes still closed, breaks into a sly, amused s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Charlotte, collars turned up against the brisk  wind, walk together. Charlotte wears a backpack. Wills tr desperately to appear casual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honestly, I think I have a right  to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I honestly think I have a right  not to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being unreasonable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being nosy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move down a winding walkway beneath barren trees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, in this day and age it's  not so outrageous a request. I mean,  I don't know this kid. I don't know  where he's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing incredulously) You're worried about where he's been?  Give me a break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills watches as Charlotte laces up her figure skates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It requires balance and I have lousy  balance, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, what's the worst that  can happen? (beat) Well, I guess you could break a hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not in a sporting mood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm jealous, okay?! Is that what you  want to hear? Are you satisfied now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She burst out laughing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills paces the bleachers, furious, while Charlotte skate nearby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want is a simple answer and  you're torturing me! And I resent  it! It's cruel and juvenile! And I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her anger startles him. She skates over quickly and skids an abrupt stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not! It's adult! It's revenge!  And if you think it's bad not knowing  what I did -- well, it's even worse  knowing exactly what you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and skates away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits on the bleachers, miserably brooding, while  Charlotte gracefully glides by, laughing and chatting wit THREE YOUNG MALE SKATERS whom she's just met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk together in silence. Wills is sullen. Finally,  Charlotte takes his hand and speaks gently but firmly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, okay? Never ask me  again what happened with Eric. Just  accept the fact that you'll never,  ever know. And if that hurts, then  think about it next time you want to  cheat on somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills reflects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte and Wills are little more than silhouettes, lyi entwined in the rich darkness, conversing in whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I were exaggerating, but I'm  not. I slept with every one of them.  Really. Look through Dolly's old  photo albums... or any movie  magazine... visit Aspen at Christmas.  I was on a mission. And until recently  I really didn't think I had a problem.  Or if I did, it was definitely the  most pleasurable one I could imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My house in Malibu burned to the  ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs. Wills smiles with sad irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it sounds funny. But it must  have triggered something because the  next thing I knew I couldn't sleep.  I'd lie awake at night absolutely  terrified. Like a kid left alone in  the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you scared of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How quickly time was passing and how  adolescent I still felt. How  meaningless all my choices seemed.  How lonely I was. So I liquidated my  portfolio, sold my businesses, and  moved back here. To start over, settle  down, start acting my age. (beat) You were supposed to be my one last  dalliance with youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for your sake, I hope I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks for a moment, then smiles, and kisses her brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits with John, Sarah, and the twins at a plastic t overrun with food, wrappers, and squashed condiment tubes Sarah speaks to Wills --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge you? Why would I? Screw the  age difference -- I like the new  you! Before Charlotte came along, do  you have any idea how hard it was to  get you to sit down for a Happy Meal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and John laugh. Molly, one of the twins, chimes in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Wills, how come you don't get  married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how come, Uncle Wills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to, Carla, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Carla! I'm Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Molly, I just haven't met the  right woman yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Charlotte? She's funny- pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Wills) It means funny and pretty. It's their  highest compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. (rising from the table) She's also demanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's decided she wants her birthday  present today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills gives both of the little girls hugs and kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dom didn't count. This is her  real present. She chose it herself  and it's not material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you got me curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills shakes his head and smiles, reluctant to answer. From the next scene we hear the sound of TWO DOZEN PEOPLE BREATHING FURIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a slightly elevated stage, HARI SINGH, 35, an American Sikh wearing a white robe and turban, sits in the lotus  position before a lighted candle, softly instructing the  crowded class --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... breath of fire... now inhale  deeply... hold the breath... let  your heart lotus blossom... feel the  energy rise... and exhale. Good. Now  peacock pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hari rolls forward, digs his elbows into his midsection, pops up so that he is parallel to the floor with his legs still crossed. ANGLE ON THE CLASS, all moving into the pose. In the cent of the class are Wills and Charlotte, wearing sweats. His arms shaking, Wills is clearly in pain. He mutters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does the enlightenment start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you realize that I'm God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills laughs. A moment later, Charlotte winces and falls of the pose onto the mat. Hari looks over, confused --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte sits up quickly, smiling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. No big deal. Cramp in the old  fifth shakra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances over at Wills. He sees that she's scared to d He helps her to her feet, speaking softly in her ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. They move toward the door. But after a few step her eyes flutter, her body goes limp, and she slams down the mat, UNCONSCIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies on a stretcher near Wills and a PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal. I just  hyperventilated. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then she gasps as she's hit by a stab of pain. Wills  throws a grave look at the medic and squeezes her hand mo tightly.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The building is brightly illuminated against the night sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits, anxiously struggling with a half-finished  crossword puzzle. He hears the click of a lighter. A GRUB LITTLE MAN standing by the coffee machine lights a generi cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... do you have an extra  one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes narrowing) You a smoker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hell, if I'm gonna be the one  to get you goin' again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills looks up and sees Dr. Sibley standing in the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sibley walks Wills down the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The repeat MRI and CAT scan do show  interval progression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertainly) Which means the tumor's grown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, it has. Considerably. As  for her loss of consciousness, one  explanation is a disturbance in her  heart's electrical function. We'll  be monitoring her overnight for any  arrhythmias. If we find something,  we'll treat it. Unfortunately, the  more likely explanation is that the  tumor has begun to obstruct the  outflow of her heart. If that's the  case, there's little we can do. We  could be speaking in terms of weeks  not months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at Charlotte's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she returns home, we'll want  her to stay active, but don't let  her overexert herself. (off Wills' nod) Don't stay long. She's been sedated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies in the bed with her eyes closed. An EKG mo bleeps steadily in the corner. An IV drip hangs by her be Wills enters and sits down at her bedside. He touches her hand. She opens her eyes and smiles drowsily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills is terribly anxious. His speech is accelerated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? You're okay? How  do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you rest. I should. You'll  sleep and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his hand) Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods and inhales deeply. His heart is racing. She murm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still owe me a birthday present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just 'cause I fainted is no excuse  for you to bail on your peacock pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles sleepily. Wills lifts a hand to her mouth and  whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ought to be illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your smile. It's too pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've ruined you for other women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All part of my master plan. (beat) Do you wanna hear a story... a bedtime  story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't I be telling you one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, there was a woman  on a ship crossing the Atlantic and  her little boy got sick. Very sick.  And she said whoever saves my boy's  life... I'll name my next baby after  them. Well, they got into port and  they rushed her son to St. Vincent's  hospital... to here... and they saved  his life. And so the mother named  her next baby Edna St. Vincent Millay. (beat) And Edna grew up to be, as I am sure  you know, the second greatest female  poet in American history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first would be Emily Dickinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a quick learner -- I like  that about you... (half to herself) "It may be, when my heart is dull,  Having attained its girth,  I shall not find so beautiful  The meagre shapes of earth,  Nor linger in the rain to mark  The small of tansy through the dark."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes drift shut --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so pretentious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills laughs, then clears his throat, and looks suddenly  serious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, listen, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Heavy, heavy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No violins. I'm fine. Go home...  sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He considers for a moment, then, tears welling in his eye he lifts her hand to his mouth and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits across from Simon who strokes Shannon's back a she weeps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just didn't seem real and now  that it is, I hate it! It's so unfair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, sitting in her armchair, mutters as though by ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fare is what you pay on the train to  Jersey. Fair is the place that smells  like manure where, if you're real  lucky, you win a blue ribbon for  your home-made pickles. Fair is a  sky without a cloud and a face with  a mark. Fare is food. What fair isn't  is everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think I speak for all of us  when I say that we've heard quite  enough from Dolores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores chuckles. Simon continues to Wills --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, correct me if I'm wrong, but I  believe what you're saying is that  while the end may be in sight, it  has not yet arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The tumor's begun to  interfere with the function of her  heart, but she --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why exactly have you called us  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills falters, looking at him incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cut short a lunch date, Shannon's  missing her low-impact aerobics class,  and Dolores has delayed the start of  her happy hour -- surely you must  have had good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Charlotte's health might  be of some interest you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. You could have told me all  about it on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also thought it might be a good  idea if we discussed ways to make  her as comfortable as possible for  the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte loathes comfortable. I  never sought to bore her with comfort  while she was well, why should I  start now that she's sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stares at Simon, his face ashen and full of contemp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, are you really so cold? Or  is it just a pose that you've  cultivated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pose that I've cultivated. (beat) I chose it, as a sort of smoke screen,  some time after attending my twentieth  funeral in as many months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite all right. But, honestly,  it shocks me how often you people  forget. Our phone books have as many  numbers crossed out as written in.  So that while death is certainly as  painful to us as it is to you, we do  not find it nearly so...  extraordinary. (beat) Don't misunderstand me. I adore  Charlotte and when she dies, I  would... were it not already in that  state... cry my heart dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon looks at Simon and burst into tears again. Simon  holds her even closer, rubbing her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills emerges from Charlotte's brownstone, hails a cab, t decides against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head down, eyes desolate, Wills walks uptown. The roaring traffic, dense crowds, blaring music, flashing neon -- th great welter of urban life is entirely lost on him. He can think only of Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills walks down a dark block, his jacket open to the col night wind, his cheeks and ears burned red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills enters, checks the tenant list, then presses a buzz He speaks into the intercom and a moment later is buzzed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW WILLS, running up the stairs. He arrives at a door cold and gasping for breath. He hears footsteps. THE DOOR OPENS, but we do not see who is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills paces, speaking desperately to someone. He seems on the verge of a total nervous collapse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the hospital now. She doesn't  have long. Weeks maybe and -- She...  Anyway, I have something to ask you.  A favor. I have no right to ask. I  know. I'd do it myself, but I can't.  I'm too... I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a deep breath to keep himself from crying. ANGLE ON LISA, his daughter, sitting on the couch, listen her face unreadable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to find a surgeon. Dr.  Sibley told me... Charlotte's doctor  told me... he said at some point,  when it's hopeless, surgery could be  an option. Heroic surgery, he called  it. I want to make sure that when  the time comes a hero is performing  that heroic surgery. Do you  understand? You'll have to make calls.  I'll get names. Sibley will give me  names. (fighting tears) I'm sorry to ask you... I have no  right. But, you see, she doesn't  want it... this surgery... I'll have  to convince her. So no one can know...  for now. And I trust you. You're my  only family and I... (beat) You have every right to refuse me.  After what I did. You were a child...  and you needed me... and I was nowhere  to be found. There's no excuse for  that. I'm so terribly sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be happy to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills, stunned, deeply grateful, allows himself a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm really sorry she's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost inaudible) I am, too. So sorry. I should be the  one. It should be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, flooded with compassion, wants to go to him, comfor him, but she stays where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkening sky is swept with a brisk wintry breeze. Sh descend from the trees and towering rocks. AN OLD MAN sit on a bench, reading a newspaper. A NANNY pushes a baby  carriage past. Wills and Charlotte walk together, bundled up again the c Charlotte walks backward, her breath shooting out into th cold air like smoke --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never talk about my mother. (beat) Talk about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. All I remember is that  she smelled like vanilla, loved to  read to me, and was really good at  cutting up fruit. I couldn't believe  she didn't cut her fingers off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I remember a little more than  that. Let's see... she was blonde...  about your height --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen pictures, dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. She... always ate her ice  cream with a fork -- how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she wrote great letters, but  couldn't spell at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither can I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a McGovern Democrat but also  an incredible snob. She loved  blueberries. She had the world's  worst backhand. Her favorite singer  was Stephen Stills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. She was afraid of sharks.  And, considering the times, she was  pretty square. She only tried drugs  once -- a lifeguard gave her a hash  brownie and she threw it up all over  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she laughed just like that. And  she bit her fingernails. And she  couldn't tell a joke. (beat) In short, she was a unique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte smiles happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Charlotte lean down on the railing, watching th water purl and eddy around Randall's Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know she was in love with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in love with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because she was the only girl  in Rhode Island who wouldn't sleep  with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how she got my attention;  it's not why I fell in love with  her. (beat) I fell in love with her because she  charmed me senseless day and night  for an entire summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you screw her best friend  on Labor Day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills looks at her darkly. She smiles and shrugs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sighs and looks away, reflecting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. The summer was over.  Your mom was going back to Smith. I  was moving down here to work on Wall  Street. It was our last day together.  She was crying. She told me, for the  first time, that she loved me. I  said I loved her, too. I promised to  call and visit. A few hours later I  was in a cabana with Millie. (beat) When Millie told me she was pregnant  and that she wanted to marry me, I  escaped to L.A... and I never saw  her or your mom again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wryly) Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's part of the reason I  never came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why're you like that? What is  it? I mean, you weren't born that  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might as well have been. For as  long as I can remember, I've always  run off at the first sign of a woman  wanting anything from me... relying  on me in any way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She considers for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want everything from you, Wills.  I rely on you in every way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the only reason you don't dump me  is because I'm sick? Because you  know that it's all going to be over,  anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But it doesn't feel that way. (beat) It feels as though I'm not afraid  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him and smiles. He puts an arm around her an draws her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills looks out the window, his arm draped around Charlot who lies nestled against him, eyes closed. He suddenly sees something. He thinks. Checks his watch. eyes ignite and he calls out excitedly to the driver --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver! Quick! Pull over here! Right  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, a little sleepy, comes to. She looks out the w and her face softens with happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the steps of the old church a CHOIR sings Christmas ca All around them, a LARGE CROWD sings along. Wills and Charlotte get out of the cab. His arm around he Wills pulls her into the crowd. They join the carol. Will sings well. Charlotte is tone deaf. In between lines of the song, she calls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you could sing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you couldn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and continues to sing. THE CAROLS ENDS to cheers and applause. THE CHOIRMASTER s forward to a microphone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you all know what time it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused to Wills) No, I don't. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins. The choirmaster nods at someone in the distance Then holds up a hand, fingers spread, and begins to count down. The crowd joins in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN, NINE, EIGHT, SEVEN, SIX, FIVE,  FOUR, THREE, TWO, ONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, ALL THE WHITE CHRISTMAS LIGHTS on the tr of the median from 96th Street to 44th Street POP ON  SIMULTANEOUSLY -- an enchanted fairy-tale spectacle. The crowd and the choir cheer and clap, cars honk their h Charlotte's eyes are filled with happy wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAPPY HOLIDAYS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
