dialogues.text: As another carol begins, Wills wraps his arms around Char and kisses her. He pulls away, looks deeply into her eyes and whispers with passionate sincerity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant, her eyes flare as though she were surpris Then her eyes fill with tears. She tries to speak but she choked by a sob. She buries her face in his chest and cries. Wills smiles  with warm, almost paternal, indulgence. He strokes her ha She hugs him as though she'll never let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant is packed. John, overwhelmed by the crowd  waiting for tables, glances angrily away when he hears th phone ringing and no one answering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the Pandemonium, Wills watches as Charlotte teases H 30, the young chef, as he lays the beet garnishes on a fi entree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call that a rose? It looks more  like a hand grenade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Keane, you get her outta here  or, I swear to God, I'm gonna  butterfly and stuff her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll add it to the specials list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No way! I'm too pricey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bangs open. John enters, looking angry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sunshine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen Celia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The matter is I got a half-hour wait  and no help up front! You got a call  on Two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills enters, picks up the phone, and hits a flashing but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills Keane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa's face is flushed with excitement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOWN CAR is parked out front. Michael, the doorman, cha with the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Tom Grandy. Harvard  undergrad. Columbia Medical School.  He's at the Cleveland Clinic. I know,  I know. But don't laugh. It's one of  the best in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills exits the building and gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town car speeds down the expressway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did his residency at the Brigham  in Boston... his cardiac surgery  training at Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills walks quickly through the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so good they kept him on and  within three years he was chief of  the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills gets out of a taxi and heads inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He travels a lot. Spends lots of  time lecturing. I got you an  appointment tomorrow at twelve-thirty.  Don't be late. He only has fifteen  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM GRANDY, 35, long-hair, small beard, loose-limbed, wea scrubs, saunters down the hall, wearing a vaguely goofy s Wills watches him approach with some apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surgeon that recommended him  said, and these are his words not  mine, "Don't let his appearance fool  you. He's brilliant and has balls  the size of your head."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills listens to Dr. Grandy who speaks casually, more lik benign hippie than a renowned surgeon. Charlotte's X-rays hang between them in an illuminated view box --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm not gonna bullshit you.  If she were a baby, she'd have a  decent chance, 'cause these sorts of  tumors can regress like crazy, but  she's twenty and... I don't know,  man... I've never seen anything like  it. (pointing at the X- ray) I mean, look! It's wrapped around  her vital structures like an octopus! (sitting) You know, just once I'd like to get  sent something simple. A "cabbage,"  a valve replacement. Even a good old- fashioned transplant. But it doesn't  happen anymore. It's the downside of  being good at my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good? They say there's no one better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm like most people.  I do the best I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can your best save her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandy and Wills walk together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In these sorts of cases, it's best  if she signs a consent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (stopping at the main  entrance) The last time Charlotte passed out,  she regained consciousness almost  immediately. The next time or the  time after, she won't. When that  happens, call me. (handing him a card) Here's my service. They'll reach me  no matter where I am. In the meantime,  I'll coordinate with Dr. Sibley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't thank you enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandy smiles and pats him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't done anything yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits up, wearing glasses, reading a book. Charlotte enters from the bathroom wearing a flannel night shirt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way -- where were you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you called I assumed you were  at the restaurant, but when I called  back later, Jesus said you hadn't  been in all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in Montclair, New Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully vague) An opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? Sexual or professional?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was considering opening a  restaurant. But the rents are too  high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her. And she smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies asleep with her head on his chest. She ope her eyes. The room seems strange. It's the light. She rises up and turns around. Her eyes narrow with curio She crawls out of bed and runs to the window and looks ou She can't believe her eyes. Central Park is blanketed by  deep snow and more is falling. She calls out gaily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! How do you feel about Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily) Bah humbug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs back, laughing, and jumps on the bed, rousting h

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: A SEQUENCE BEGINS showing Charlotte and Wills during a da of holiday shopping. The deep snow has slowed the city to crawl but filled everyone with good spirits. Charlotte and Wills move from store to store; they buy  wreaths, garlands, ornaments, candles, and, finally, a  CHRISTMAS TREE and STAND. Wills starts to lug the tree, but when it's obvious that  it's too much for him, Charlotte spots a GROUP OF KIDS  spilling out of a record store. The next thing we know the kids are lined up, carrying th tree over their heads like a battalion of ants. Wills and the kids load the tree into the freight elevato and squeeze in. There's no room for Charlotte. She'll tak the lobby elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, carrying shopping bags, ascends in silence wit Michael. She has no interest in chatting. He, as ever, do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you and Mister Keane be goin'  away for the holidays?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen so little of America. I  don't care for airplanes, you see,  and I have so little time to travel. (beat) Did Mister Keane enjoy his trip then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, just yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't really call that a trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not. But I've never been to  Ohio myself. They say parts of it  are quite lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte goes pale. The elevator stops and he opens the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte steps out right into the kids who are roughhous and laughing. Each holds a five-dollar bill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) All right, you little hellions! Get  in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte wanders in. The tree stands erect. Wills, on al fours, tightens the screws on the stand. He crawls to his feet and studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he sees her grave expression and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we do. About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying. (beat) You were in Ohio yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stares at her for a moment, then explains without  apology --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met with a heart specialist. He's  willing to operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant she is surprised, but then her indignation takes over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know I don't want that! You  know I've signed papers that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't your decision!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not, but if you'll hear me  out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I told you right from the start  how I felt and you went behind my  back! You lied and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Oh, Christ, knock it off! You're  such a god damn saint, so above it  all, but you're scared to death! You  do want to live! And if you were as  honest as you say you are you'd let  the doctors do whatever they can to  help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face shuts like a trap. She walks toward the bedroom  door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't give people hope when there  isn't any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?! Maybe we want hope! Or  maybe we just need to know that we  did everything we could! Maybe I  need to know that... if I'm going to  be able to live... to go on without...  without --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a sob catches in his throat. Charlotte, on her to the bedroom, stops and slowly turns around. She speaks matter-of-factly, without judgment or feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know why you hurt so many women.  Because you always knew if you held  on to one of them, you'd never let  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and exits coldly to the bedroom. Wills sinks in an armchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In grey afternoon shadows, Charlotte lies on her side, fu clothed under the covers, with her eyes open, thinking. S hears something and looks back. Wills stands in the lighted doorway. She gestures for him to come. He walks over and lies down next to her. She turns her back to him, so that he's spoo her, but she takes hold of his hand, pressing it against chest and squeezing it like a doll. For a long time, they lie in silence. Finally, she murmur almost inaudibly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we met, I was so lonely. But I  didn't even know it. I'd been alone  so long.. almost forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So had I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now we have each other. (beginning to cry) Oh, what would I do, Wills? What  would I do if you weren't here? Where  would I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting his emotions, determined to stay strong for her, holds her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't ever have to worry about  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever I have to! I'll  tear up the papers! Whatever you  want! Tell the doctor! Because... I  really do want... I don't want to  leave you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dam breaks and she is wracked by sobs. Wills closes h eyes, holds her even tighter, and rocks her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, still fully clothed, lies sound asleep. She sl awakens and sees that Wills is gone. She gets up on one e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits, hears hurried steps, then Wills sticks his hea in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was I asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. And I'm still tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte senses something odd in his tone. Her eyes narr with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and starts to get up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't! Don't move! Just one more  minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills runs back into the room. The tree is fully decorate now. He dashes back and adjust some lights along the base

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the bedroom) What're you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs over, inserts the plug and the TREE LIGHTS UP wit LITTLE WHITE LIGHTS, but for the STAR AT THE TOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! You didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just going to tire yourself  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a chair and fiddles with the bulb inside the sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This I've gotta see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE STAR LIGHTS UP. He jumps down and puts the chair away Then he runs over and dims the lights --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finishing touches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs over and adjusts a garland. He runs back to the d and adjusts it again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs back to the bedroom door and flings it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voila!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks into the room and freezes in the doorway. He bac up a step, then, crying out, lunges into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, lying unconscious on a stretcher, wearing an o mask, is rushed into a waiting ambulance. Wills, beside  himself with panic, is gently barred by a MEDIC from jump in with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the reflection of a projected slide, a hand offers a  CELLULAR PHONE to Dr. Grandy, standing at a lectern in fr of a group of doctors. He stops his lecture and takes the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance rushes, light flashing, sirens wailing,  downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte's stretcher is rushed into the emergency room a the same time that Wills' cab pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandy is rushed into a MEDICAL HELICOPTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills looks up and sees Dolores and Shannon arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandy's helicopter speeds toward the City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills comforts Shannon. Dolores looks up and sees Simon  standing in the doorway. Then a CORONARY CARE NURSE appea She asks to speak to Wills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandy looks out the window as the helicopter swoops down toward the lights of lower Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies, semi-conscious, on a gurney. Wills appear in the doorway with the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lands and Grandy jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills sits down next to Charlotte's bed. He touches her h Her eyes open then close again. Her breathing is heavy an labored. Wills pushes a lock of hair off her brow, then whispers,  half to himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time cannot break the bird's wing  from the bird. Bird and wing together  Go down, one feather. No thing that  ever flew, not the lark, not you,  Can die as others do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte's eyes open dreamily. She shows a faint smile a the poem and murmurs almost inaudibly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruined me for other women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I saved you for them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes close. Wills takes her hand and presses it to hi cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she type 'n' cross for six units?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills turns around and sees Grandy standing in the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just you, Doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NURSE rushes over to the gurney and in an instant  Charlotte is gone -- wheeled with a bang through SWINGING DOORS into the operating room corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is there now -- John, Sarah, Celia, Simon, Dolor and Shannon. Wills enters silently. He walks to the new  arrivals and greets each one with an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies on the table. Grandy's eyes, visible above his mask, are fiercely focused on his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon lies with her head in Sarah's lap. Dolores, ignoring the sign, smokes a cigarette. John and Celia sit side-by-side in silence. Wills stands at the window. He looks over and see Simon  standing close by. Simon looks at him, his eyes sad but e calm. Wills shakes his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened so quickly. We'd just  talked about the surgery. She agreed  to it. But I thought there'd be time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had friends who weren't expected  to last till morning who lived another  seven years. Another ran a marathon  and died the next weekend. It's all  so terribly random the way life  actually works. I take nothing for  granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light enters Wills' eye. He smiles as he remembers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's funny, the first time  I saw her, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Wills hears something. He turns and there's Gran at the end of the long hall, walking toward the waiting r Simon looks and sees him, too. Wills looks at Simon with alarm. It's impossible. How cou Grandy be finished so soon? Wills looks back at Grandy.

dialogues.speaker: SLOW-MOTION
dialogues.text: Grandy moves with long strides down the corridor. One by one, as they notice, Charlotte's loved ones react the sight of Grandy. Shannon rises from Sarah's lap, looks at the doctor, then covers her face with her fists, holding her breath. Dolores crushes out her cigarette, her expression falling Celia touches John's back as he rises and walks over to W Simon's face turns to stone. John reaches for Wills, but Wills advances a few steps to the corridor, almost defiantly, his eyes riveted to Grand Grandy's head is down. Then, ever so slowly, Grandy lifts his head and in one  decisive move YANKS OFF HIS SURGICAL MASK and THROWS IT  AGAINST THE WALL. CLOSE ON WILLS' FACE as he realizes. His mouth opens wide as though to cry out, but no sound c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills stands in the center of the room wearing his overco He is pale, exhausted, his face expressionless. John stands, also wearing his coat, in the hall archway,  unsure whether he should stay or leave. Wills looks at the Christmas tree, whose lights still bur He slowly walks over and pulls the cord from the wall. The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COUPLE walks down the same walkway. They are deep in su conversation. All around them spring is in full glory. Me snow. Trees exploding with green. Birds singing. The man is Wills Keane, but he has markedly changed. His  dress is not so impeccable, his hair has gone grey at the temples. His face, though still beautiful, has gracefully turned the corner into middle age. Walking at his side is his daughter, Lisa, now well along her pregnancy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, to be honest, Peter's more  than a little freaked. I mean, how  could he not be? He's twenty-six.  His first child. A baby girl, no  less. Nothing really prepares you  for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it's the first time since we  got married that he's actually  realized what marriage is. That it's  forever. That he can't just pick up  and run away to Nepal or something  if we have a fight. That he's part  of the cycle of things now. That  he's gonna die some day. That it's  the next generation's turn to take  the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills and Lisa walk together in silence, enjoying the per afternoon. Then Lisa smiles crookedly and slaps his shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about you, Mr. Keane? You  ready to be a grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wills looks over at the spot where he first saw Charlotte He smiles with wistful confidence then, a little awkwardl puts his arm around his daughter. She is surprised at first. But then slowly, trustingly, s rests her head on his shoulder. And they walk.
